title: Excellent Support Service
body: Today, my wife took a prescription for eight weeks of medication to our local chemist which had been prescribed to her by the Consultant at Worcestershire Royal Hospital. The on duty chemist refused to prepare the eight weeks of medication and he would only dispense two weeks of medication. We immediately went to Elbury Moor Surgery and the Practice Nurse - Respiratory consulted with one of the GP’s. The GP concerned immediately issued a prescription for six weeks of medication. Absolutely brilliant service from both the Practice Nurse and GP. Their actions prove to me that the NHS is well and alive at Elbury Moor Surgery.

author: Chelsie
title: Post operative wound care
body:
I had an operation 3 weeks ago for carpel tunnel release and attended my local treatment room which is situated inside the Waterside Health Centre in Londonderry. The care that I received from the nurses and the admin team was amazing. I was taken care of with the utmost respect, gentleness and kindness.  
Any questions that I asked, even if I thought they were silly or insignificant were answered honestly and professionally. I would especially like to thank Moira, who saw me on 3 separate occasions over the last few weeks, thankyou for your attentiveness and for the treatment of my wound, which is now well on the road to recovery.

title: Phenomenal care across the whole hospital
body:
My husband who is young and healthy was admitted to A&E last Sunday having had a major stroke out of the blue.
I can’t speak highly enough of the care we got from everyone in the NHS. 
Given the severity of the case we had an ambulance and they reached us in only 15 mins which was a huge relief and the paramedics were fabulous.
 He was prioritised in A&E and put on the life saving medication he needed in just 2 hours. The staff were kind and caring and always communicated with me and my husband despite being hugely busy. 
He then spent time on HDU also where the care was wonderful and they really looked out for him. 
Finally he made it to the stroke unit and the team of nurses, doctors and therapists were all amazing and did everything possible to support his swift recovery. 
He made it out of hospital last night which really defies the odds of what should be expected and I will be forever grateful to all the wonderful team at Epsom hospital.
On top of this I am 8.5 months pregnant so it was very stressful for me but they also always took care of me. The maternity team even fitted me in and hoc to check that the baby and I were okay given the stress of everything happening. 
Our next trip to Epsom hospital is hopefully going to be on much happier terms with the arrival of our baby in about 2 weeks time! 
The staff and care at Epsom is nothing short of wonderful and they deserve every credit. 
It was the hardest week of our lives but they made it easier to cope. And they truly care- for example the A&E doctor and Stroke specialist nurse who treated my husband in A&E took time to visit him later in the week to see how he was doing.

title: Shocking telephone service
body:
I keep receiving text messages re testing for medication level. I am not on any medication. Tried to contact them and after 28 minutes kept on you are caller number two on three occasions and being on the correct option put the phone down.
They state that they are accepting new patients. Please deal with existing ones first.

title: No Answer
body: I contacted this medical practice in my capacity as a hospital pharmacist, so that I could confirm a patient's medication as they were on holiday. I waited on the phone for over 30 minutes, constantly being told that I was in position 2 in the queue, but there was no progress and I didn't have time to wait any longer. I struggle to believe that the people in the queue before me were on the phone for 30 minutes, which makes me suspect that the receptionists were not actually answering the phone at all. An option for healthcare professionals to speak to a receptionist without waiting would be helpful and I feel sympathy for the patients having to routinely wait this long to speak to someone.

title: Online booking
body:
I used the new online booking service, it was simple and easy. I was reviewed quickly and able to book an appointment for the next day.
Swift and effective service at the surgery as well, very impressed!

title: Gone downhill unreliable
body: Unmanned reception desk at Ryton. 1 receptionist on at Crawcrook. Queue meant by the time I reached desk I was late by 10minutes. Receptionist doesn't assist a wheelchair user I.e. didn't move to lower counter but didn't even stand up to see me! No consideration

title: Very poor service
body: I have been a patient of Fitzrovia Medical Centre  for many years as it provided a very good service.  The last 3 years standards have dropped to rock bottom.  It is impossible to get an appointment as they are released on certain days and times and if you are lucky you might get one. I am a pensioner and on occasions have gone to A&E and when desperate I have seen private doctors. I understand from reception that doctors are sick and on holidays. This is always the reason why appointments are unavailable.  Instead they are suggesting another practice that have appointments on tap.  When I looked into this practice, they have a 1 star rating.  These are patient comments about this practice 'avoid' 'awful practice' 'very distressing experience' and many more.  I am assuming that Fitzrovia Medical centre is about to close and I am now looking to register with another practice.

title: Rather Disappointing
body:
I was told to arrive for my Hernia repair at 07:30.  As there no bed was available, until about 10:00 I sat in the reception area. During that time I was interviewed by the surgeon and the anaesthetist in what was described by one of the staff as broom cupboards. At around 10:00 I was taken to change for the op and then walked to the theatre. I came round in the recovery room at about 11:45 and there I remained for 3 hrs waiting for a ward bed. The nurse who was looking after me was very attentive and caring. 

I cannot say the same for the nurse in the rs sssu Bay 6 Bed 2. When I was in the ward I was just left. I had to call the nurse after about 30 minutes for my belongings to be brought to me having already discussed what had happened to them on my arrival in the ward. I saw the the two surgeons after the op who said I could go after I had   urinated. After I had been about an hour or so later and returned to the bed I called the nurse and told her I had urinated and that I had come over very hot while standing and a bit wobbly on my legs. She couldn't have been more disinterested and gave me the impression I was wasting her time. At no time through the whole stay did she come and check on me medically, although she did bring me a cup of tea and a sandwich.

At 17:00 when another patient was being served his evening meal I called over a student nurse who was making up a bed and and asked what the game plan for me was. The student was aware I supposed to be discharged but until I asked there had been no movement or discussion in that direction.

When I was given my discharge papers I was also handed a pamphlet about the repair of Epigastric......Henia's  Form Pin180110-1439. I had a Inguinal Hernia and should have been give form Pin220311-1438. I found the correct form on line today at home.

In short it was a disappointing experience although I praise the Recovery Nurse and the Student Nurse for their attention.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great sessions
body: My sessions with my therapist were extremely useful. She was so understanding and gave me useful practices and techniques to help me. I cant thank her enough x

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust

title: Professional, caring, quick service
body:
Yesterday morning I phoned the practice about a medical concern.
Within a couple of hours I went through the triage  arrangement which led to an appointment to see my GP that afternoon. The GP gave me time to explain  my concern, listened carefully and he drew up a appropriate action plan to follow. No rush at all. Xray arranged for the following day in nearby hospital. This is the NHS at its best.

title: Fantastic nurse and and training lady
body:
Came in had something in my eye very nice and put me at ease young  lady training did a fantastic job with putting yellow dye in my
Eye would definitely go there again. Everyone was so nice and very helpful Thankyou

title: Thankyou
body: My mother received the best of care over the 2 weeks she was with you. Professionalism and kindness underpinned what you did with challenging patients. Mum improved physically and mentally. Thankyou

readBy.name: Norfolk Community Health and Care NHS Trust

title: Amazing people and care
body:
I recently joined Haigh Hall Medical Centre as a new patient; I called today to make enquiries regarding my repeat prescriptions that I was no longer able to access - this issue was rectified promptly by the extremely polite and efficient reception team member.

I also took the opportunity to seek a medical appointment for a general health check which I hadn't had completed for a number of years.  To my pleasant surprise, I was offered a same day appointment and given enough time to be able to go through the matters I wished to discuss with the doctor.  The doctor I saw was really lovely and welcoming; she listened to my issues and then gave me a really thorough check up, explaining as she went for anything I needed to understand.  I feel like I've found a really great practice and am very grateful for the wonderful service received - thank you :)

title: Well managed practice
body: Recently registered and astonished how caring this surgery is compared to my old one.They actually care and follow up any problems encountered and resolve in a timely manner.Excellent patient care appears evident in the short time i have been registered here.Nothing is too much of a problem.Reception staff are pleasant to deal with and converse in a pleasant and caring way.What a refreshing change to be treated like a normal human being !

title: Great reception staff and two of the best gps
body: Both gps in this surgery are brilliant at what they do they go through everything explain everything with care and compassion there on the ball with follow up’s referrals and give you best treatment and advice there is also 1 receptionist in particular that would go above and beyond to help get the answers or help you need I appreciate all the help from this person and the 2 gps thank you so much

title: Really good practice
body:
Rang up asking to see a doctor and a doctor rang me back the same morning to triage my symptoms over phone. They then offered me an in person appointment the next day.

Staff and doctor were polite and professional. Took time to listen to me. Overall very satisfied with the practice, their timeliness and overall patient experience. Based on this and other interactions with the practice I would highly recommended them.

title: An amazing practice
body: Always so kind,  caring and reassuring.  This practice is one in a million and we are very fortunate to be patients there.

title: Excellent Service  5 Stars
body:
Arrived by Ambulance. Very busy. Long queues of people on trolleys.
When seen excellent standards of care. Everyone 
seemed very efficient and were all very pleasant people.  Lots of tests with seemingly very quick results.
Could not praise the whole organisation too highly.
Very well done and I for one am grateful. 
Many Thanks.
Special mention for the lady outside in the corridor. 
She seemed annoyed and grumpy mutterings under her breath! However as the hours went by it was obvious that she was exceptionally hard working organising everything. Clearly a motivated and invaluable employee.  Well done.

title: great team
body: my husband and I  joined practice last year one thing I liked about it was  staff made  sure we understood how practices running's   When we have both been unwell I could not ask for more  when we call practice  keep up the good work

title: Great
body: I found blood in my poo, rang doctors was seen by doctor, had blood test, poo test, and phone appointment from Worthing hospital all within 3 weeks, thankfully all test was clear

title: exceeded all expectations
body:
I was in hailsham ward for my prostrate repair called a turp, everyone while I was in that ward made me feel at ease and any pain was carried out to ensure I was very comfortable and any emergencies were handled in a prompt manner.
I was more worried about this operation than my open-heart avr surgery in 2017. the anaesthetist discussed a spinal nerve bloock and this was excellent, as no post op nausea at all, and by day 2, no analgesia was needed, so a huge thank you

title: Still waiting
body:
I had my left eye cataract done December last year.

Still waiting for my right eye appointment.

I was told it would be done 6 weeks after my left eye.
 
Here we are 6 months on and not heard a dickey bird!!!!

title: Terrible practice
body: Honestly a terrible practice, long wait times on phones, can't get prescription I need, it is incredibly dirty and dusty in some areas, Staff don't really seem to care. Would recommend looking elsewhere in the area.

title: Struck off for no reason
body: I have been with this surgery for 50 years and because I don't visit them regularly, they have removed me from their care without any notice. This came as a shock and has cause me a lot of distress. I visited the surgery today to find out some more information and it was a complete farce. They talk to you outside the front door in front of many people with no regard to privacy so everyone knows what you are there for.

title: Amazing experience
body: I had a minor surgery yesterday and the nurses were so lovely and welcoming, made the experience very pleasant and enjoyable.

title: Reassuring service
body: I attended a routine diabetic review and was dealt with professionally and courteously.   The clinician was knowledgable and engaged.

title: Prompt and helpful advice following…
body:
I submitted an e-consultation at 1051hrs today and promptly had a text telling me a clinician would be in touch this morning. At 1243hrs I had a call from a GP.
I received advice and suggested treatment. Thank you to the whole team - very much appreciate your efficient process and care I have received.

title: Busy Practice
body:
This is a busy Practice and should not accept new patients because it's already got too many for them to cope with.
The Doctors and Nurses are excellent but over worked due to the large number of Patients they have to service

title: Dreadful service
body: This practice used to be so good. Now they don’t care about their patients. Rude reception staff, dirty waiting areas, try and get a face to face doctors appointment, good luck!!

title: Response to feedback
body:
Leaving this positive review after a negative experience earlier today.
Very quickly rectified in professional manner. Thank you 💙

title: Great nurse
body: My son had to have a blood test, he was very nervous and anxious. The nurse we had was very patient and kind and with this managed to get my son to have the blood test after an hour or struggle!

title: Much improved
body:
I called this morning and was offered a face-to-face appointment in the early morning. The doctor saw me on time and was very thorough in her examination of my injury. This resulted in 3 referrals to various clinics and the necessary paperwork was made available promptly.
The improvement in access to medical care at the surgery under the current regime is remarkable. The reception staff continue (as they always have been) to be helpful and friendly.

title: Amazing staff
body:
Having gone into the surgery with concerns regarding my 90 year old mum very late in the day the receptionist was incredibly compassionate, kind and really proactive to enable my mum to see a doctor which I feel prevented another possible hospital visit for her.
She is really appreciated and a total credit to the practice.

title: An Improving practice
body:
As we are aware, there are staff shortages within the Uk's  National Health Service. 

That said, my experience with the surgery today was really positive. Staff were helpful and friendly. 

In the absence of a doctor's appointment, I was offered an on the day physio appointment. This is virtually unheard of. However, an amazing service to be offered as it eradicates waiting times after the doctor's referral. 

The first contact physio was most helpful offering advice on how to care for my back with exercise, medication and icing.  

I believe the first contact physiotherapist is also able to prescribe medication. However, since I mentioned that I had medication, this was not necessary. 

I left the surgery feeling a lot better as I was also offered a reset of my back which immediately made a difference. 

Additionally, I was offered a referral to an external physio for another problem I have.

Overall, the service offered to me today, was amazing.

title: Fantastic practice
body: Absolutely fantastic I can’t read them enough so much faster than waiting for the standard NHS facilities which was a three year waiting list. The patient portal is very easy to use and they are very responsive. There is always somebody on hand to help you highly recommend them

title: Some doctors are good but the place has terrible…
body:
This place is not managed.
Their method of communication with patients is a disaster.
Their responses are irrelevant and not helpful.
Just as an example, three months ago I wrote to them asking them to update their outgoing message on a answer phone because during the waiting time it repeats the very same messages constantly which causes stress especially for elderly.  No one cared about my communication except a standard message came to me saying "they always care"!!!
Management needs changing fast.

title: Great Service
body: Had telephone consultation with GP & was advised that I needed to be seen.  I was in GP surgery 40 minutes later .  Couldn’t fault the service

title: Prompt attention
body:
Contacted surgery on the Monday late morning regarding leg problem. The receptionist was very helpful and guided me to use the 111 service. The 111 service made an appointment for me on the Monday evening with my own GP. I saw the GP who advised further medication and gave a further appointment on the Tuesday evening. The GP them contacted NHS at home who gave me an appointment on the Wednesday morning for further assessment and review.
Although the leg isn’t yet fully recovered the access to the GP and additional support was very good and probably exceeded expectations. 
As people will complain about lack of service etc then I feel it is important to call out the positive service that I received.

title: Friendly helpful practice
body: Was seen on time friendly Doctor went through what was needed and a good end result clean environment easy booking in on the app screen but worry mainly older people struggling with this system staff very welcoming could not say how helpful everyone is especially with urgent appointments

title: Good practice
body: Professional and kind, never rushed, both with doctors receptionists and nurses whether online on the phone or in person

title: Absolutely pointless
body: The Healthy Minds service is absolutely pointless, nobody cares about your well-being in the slightest, it is merely a box ticking exercise for the NHS. They couldn’t care less if you have mental health issues or not. No wonder men find it difficult to talk when you get this kind of response and treatment.

readBy.name: Herefordshire and Worcestershire Health and Care NHS Trust

title: Quick response
body: I was in desperate need of help with a prescription problem and the operations manager got back to me within a couple of hours and resolved my issue quickly and calmly and eased my anxiety instantly. Thank you so much Operation Manager!

title: Terrible appointment system
body: Impossible to book an appointment. Told to call Friday pm after 1:30, but phone lines are too busy and call cuts off. How is someone who works full time able to get an appointment? My wife is disabled and has to resort to physically visiting the surgery on a Friday afternoon to book as she can’t ever get through on the phone. How is this fair? The current system is discriminatory and impossible. Staff are unsympathetic and simply don’t care when expressing concern. We have never known a surgery like this. All surgeries have some difficulty with appointment booking but this is by far the worst.

title: How on earth are you supposed to get an…
body:
I don't go to the Drs very often-but when I do it would be nice to 
a) get through on the phone
b)not to be told to call back on Friday after 13:30
c) not have to call 37 times before i can even get in que to get a call back
d) then told no appointments
e)not have been trying for 2 weeks to get an appointment.
Your strap line of excellent patient care is your aim and priority is a joke when you cannot even get the basics right.

title: Great Doctors
body:
What a wonderful surgery.
They seem to care about you and take care of you.
All the Doctors are really good and the lead Doctor is a skin specialist as well as a G. P.

title: Incompetent staff in Minor Injuries Unit
body: My son attended the Minor Injuries Unit after injuring his foot. The nurse(?) who saw him was dismissive and unprofessional. She said he might have broken a toe but it needed no treatment and that the pain he felt was because of his low pain tolerance. An X-ray taken later at a different hospital showed that he had fractured a metatarsal and had a fracture with displacement of a toe. I am appalled that my son, who was in great pain when he attended the Minor Injuries Unit, was treated in such a callous manner.

readBy.name: Cambridgeshire And Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust

title: Real encouragement
body: Really great experience from receptionist right through to the doctor’s consultation, diagnosis, explanation, prescription, and personal manner.  So encouraged.  Thank you.

title: No way to book appointments
body: I am deaf, and they don’t offer any way to book appointments except by phone. There is literally no way to book if you are deaf. So deaf people living in Woolwich are just left to die I guess.

title: No promised call from Dr
body:
I was supposed to have a call back from a Dr regarding my recent CT scan at 13:30 but nothing. I have been trying to call the practice but as usual no reply after nearly 30 minutes. This call is potentially very important to me but not to staff who do not pick up the phone. I am number 1 in your queue and have been for some 30 minutes, can you please amend your recorded message so it doesn't say that my call is important to you.

Lee

title: I was humiliated  over the phone
body: I have never been more embarrassed  and been made to fell like more of a inconvenience then when talking to the receptionist at this surgery.

title: Great practice
body: One of the best blood tests as notoriously difficult previously. Friendly and professional nurse. One of the best

author: librast39
title: Excellent service & super attitude
body:
Pre cataract surgery. Checklist completed on a question and answer process by a nurse. Followed by a check done on my eyes.  
Excellent service & super attitude to me the patient. I was made to feel very comfortable with a smile.  
Staff obviously comfortable in their surrounds, no stairs. Falmouth health centre light, windows pleasant, parking easy. Venue much better than the basement at the Tower Block in Treliske, hence happy staff & patient. Altogether a good experience.  
Thank you.

title: Professional and caring
body: Attended for difficult and challenging extraction.  Throughout the process the staff couldn't have been more reassuring.  I knew that the procedure would be difficult but the standard of treatment could not have been more professional and was entirely pain-free.

readBy.name: Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant
body: I attended minor injuries with split stitches after recent surgery. I had problems as the the bleeding would not stop. A number of nursing professionals saw me to add their weight of knowledge to end the day with my wound stable and back on the road to recovery. Thankyou all.

title: Practice is slowly improving
body: Visited the gp this morning. She was very thorough and didn't rush me. It would be so much easier if you could pre  book appointments like pre Covid time.

title: Professional
body: I found this practice to be very professional no problem making an appointment.and was seen within 15 minutes of my arrival on day of appointment,a lot better now than it was a few years back ,would definitely recommend it

title: Superb administrators
body: The medical administration team at this surgery are wonderful. In a confusing crisis where personal items had been found in a London shop, the medical secretaries contacted my family to alert them of the discovery. The medical secretaries ensured they accurately recorded the details and communicated all of this to me, in a climate of compassion and caring. Despite the obvious pressures that come with the role, the medical administrators were very thoughtful and considerate when sharing information with me. I am hugely grateful to them - and the issue with the personal items in a London shop has been resolved, very happily.

title: Fantastic Service and Staff
body:
I just wanted to write and let you know how wonderful your short term intervention team have been.  My Dad was in hospital for a few weeks with a UTI and when he came out of hospital we were given short term intervention care, he came home for 2 weeks and unfortunately got another UTI (which the carers picked up on during their morning call, they said Dad wasn’t right and too keep an eye on him), which we did but he had UTI sepsis so another stay in hospital.

The care, support and advice provided not only to my Dad but to us as a family has been fantastic.  They are friendly, approachable and very professional.  

The carers made a very big difference to us.  They guided us through the use of the hoist, bed etc.  The help to us has been invaluable.

title: Excellent Practice
body: Never have any problems  getting an appointment..with a gp via telephone or face to face. Any problems we come across are easily discussed and sorted out

title: Very good facility
body: Very clean and comfortable with very attentive and reassuring staff a really good experience every step of the way I would recommend Newmedica judged on the treatment I received. Excellent

title: So pleased you have econsult, fantastic news
body: So pleased you have econsult, fantastic news, so helpful.  Please keep it!!  It makes the process so much easier than hanging on the phone and you are able to advise of all the problems in on ego and the GP decide whether you need to come in or not rather than waiting for calls first or trying to call to book a routine appointment.

title: Great service
body: I was made to feel very welcome and the nurse was very professional. I enjoyed my experience even though I was apprensive

title: Lovely little practice
body: Always a good experience here. Staff are cheerful and friendly. The GP I saw was very good, helpful and caring.

title: Fabulous service every time
body:
I have visited the practice for a couple of reasons over the last year. Each time I have managed to get a face to face appointment, on the day. The doctors have been thorough and patient and I have never felt rushed or sped through the appointment time. They have listened and I have been heard.

In my own work I hear the challenges patients often face trying to access their GP’s but this is not the case at Woodbrook.

The doctors, nurses and support staff should be very proud of the service they are delivering as they are doing a fantastic job in very difficult times.

Thank you

title: Great Practice
body:
I was attending the 1 Stop Breast Clinic because of an anomaly in a CT scan. I was given thorough testing and a biopsy taken. At all times I was treated with meticulous care and was re assured by the competence and professionalism of the hard working registrar and all the staff who worked in this busy department.
I had an opportunity to talk about any concerns I had before I left after the department.

I was very quickly given my results as soon as they were available.
I was very impressed by the service and care I received .

title: Ear Syringe
body: Practice nurse was very friendly and syringed my ‘deaf’ very well. She will follow up with me after 48 hrs with a telephone call to see if syringing worked. Good service all round.

title: Great practice
body: I moved into the area recently and registered with Chatfield. Registration (online) was easy. There was a swift response (by SMS) to confirm that I was accepted onto the practice list.  I was then able (online again) to book a face-to-face appointment, at which I was referred to the Rheumatology Department of a local hospital for ongoing treatment for osteoporosis. Everything went smoothly. Communication was excellent throughout. I feel very well looked after.

title: My review
body: Short delay on busy Monday morning at 8.15 getting into phone queue. Thereafter service was very good. Telephone consultation with GP that afternoon followed by surgery consultation on Tuesday afternoon. On time, thorough and pleased with outcome.

title: Excellent care by ambulance service and A&E
body: I would like to thank the ambulance staff and A&E staff for their excellent care for my husband today who had a suspected TIA. I think we were very lucky that it was an unusual 'quieter' day, as they always run off their feet, but due to the nature of the emergency the ambulance came quickly and we were treated by all the NHS staff with the utmost care and friendliness. They couldn't do enough for us.

title: Amazing staff
body:
I recently attended the admissions/short stay surgical unit. From the moment I arrived on the unit, until discharge later that same day the whole experience was faultless. The staff were helpful, professional and friendly, from reception right the way through to the short stay ward. It is a very busy unit and you can see they all are working really hard but still manage to put the patient first. 
The staff in the anaesthetics room and ward staff were amazing. 
I was a little apprehensive about procedure, but the staff in pre op put me at ease. The after care on the ward even down to the cups of tea and sandwiches was great. 
Thank you to all the staff.

title: Excellent doctor
body: I had a very good experience with the lady Doctor.  She was kind and listened to what was bothering me with my health . She explained in layman terms about my condition and showed me pictorial examples from the Internet.  I left  feeling very positive

title: Really good practice
body: Used E consult and it was excellent and the response was as it said.  I have now spoken to a doctor and seen her and everything is sorted.

title: A really pleasant experience
body: I visited the endoscopy department today on Willow ward at Rugby St Cross. I was welcomed by a really friendly receptionist that got me booked in and passed to the nursing team. The nurses and other professionals put me at ease and were really supportive and comforting. I completed my visit and was discharged with my paperwork and clear instructions. I would certainly recommend the hospital and staff and would like to thank them for their amazing care and professionalism.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Wonderful Staff
body: I received nothing but kindness and care from the staff, which helped me relax and undergo the procedure with less anxiety.

title: Well done!
body: My husband rang 111 today to ask for advice regarding an insect bite to his calf. His calf had swollen over night, was red and hot to the touch. After numerous questions 111 made a request for his Dr to phone him. The doctor rang him within the hour offering a face to face appointment for 1 hour later, in order that he could examine his leg. After his thorough examination he concluded that he needed further investigation and blood tests at the hospital. This he arranged and my husband was seen at the AEC unit at the Royal Stoke an hour later. All the staff we met today from reception, nurses and doctors were polite, courteous, friendly, knowledgeable, efficient and professional. Well done Furlong Medical Centre and AEC unit at the Royal Stoke and thank you for sorting my husband.

title: Excellent practice in all services
body:
The practice has been incredible in supporting me post-surgery. 
From the efficient and timely processing of Klinik submissions and excellent service form the team processing these requests, to the GPs who have been caring and proactive in following up on any concerns and required referrals and results, and recently the nurses who have been treating a subsequent injury. 
At what has been a sensitive time the service provided has been supportive and ensured that any concerns and issues were addressed quickly, appropriately, and compassionately. Thank you.

title: Comprehensive examination and investigation,…
body: Thanks to the doctor I seen today, he was very comprehensive with a long standing issue I have.  He did all examinations again and was detailed and helpful and did not make me feel uncomfortable.

title: Good practice
body:
Admin staff, nurses and GPs have all helped me in the past few months, when I needed help and support for my mental health and continue to offer support and more importantly understanding of my situation.
I have been able to talk about my concerns and have never felt rushed. They are all doing a good job despite the stressful nature of their job.

title: Great service and knowledge
body: Very understanding regarding injury and everything explained in non medical terms with no rush and no pressure

title: A very good service
body: I needed an emergency appointment and called on a Friday afternoon just on the off chance a nurse or GP could call me back. Not only was I called back within 15 minutes but the GP saw me within the hour and an urgent referral done. I was so surprised and relieved and grateful. I have been attending this GP service since I moved to Bournemouth 17 years ago, I have always had great care. Thank you very much.

title: Brilliant service
body: I was sceptical about how much therapy would help me, but it turned out to be brilliant. I couldn't have got through the last couple of months without it. I learnt so many things that helped me to cope.

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body: Great receptionists, very accommodating and friendly. The nurses and Drs all helpful. I’ve been in numerous times within the last month and each time there has been friendly staff.

title: Patchs
body: Used the Patchs system for the first time, & was very impressed with the service. Easy to use & GP  telephoned me shortly after submitting details. Very satisfactory outcome.

title: Excellent service
body:
I contacted the surgery via the online request service. I sent my request approximately 10am.
The Nurse Practitioner called me via telephone around 1pm regarding my problem, discussed my request, and dealt with it very professionally. I was impressed with the excellent service. 29/06/2023.

title: Very Impressed
body: Visited A&E Last night after dislocating my shoulder, all staff from being greeted at the door to triage were engaging, informative, professional with some added humour. Mainly aimed at me as I had a monkey on my cap who as it turned out looked remarkably like me dragging my injured arm along the floor. I was seen swiftly, x rayed and fixed up and sent on way. I’d like to express my thanks to everyone who greeted and looked after me, keep doing what you’re doing, it was a huge (but pleasant) difference than what I was imagining on my way there. Thanks Again Guys, great job by all :-)

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Wonderful
body:
After making my way to the hospital on a rainy morning for major surgery in a haze of fear and apprehension, I was so incredibly grateful to have time take talk through the surgery with both the surgeon (who had been the consultant prior, for which I will leave a separate review under gynaecology) and the anaesthetist. Given that this was the first encounter with the anaesthetist I was really surprised at how quickly I felt at ease and trusting that I was going to be in good hands.
For someone to make such a positive impact in such a short space of time is really such a testament to the skill and expertise they bring to the role and the interpersonal skills which are so crucial for patients at such times to make things just a little less frightening.
Following the surgery, I didn’t feel any adverse affects form the anaesthesia and I feel this is further testament to the dedication and skill of the anaesthetics team looking after me during surgery - I really cannot thank them enough.
The surgeon also did a fantastic job but will review separately, as there is so much to say about them and the exemplary treatment.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great patient experience
body: On the couple of occasions I have needed to contact the surgery for an appointment it has been a straightforward experience and all staff from reception through to GPs and nurses have been friendly, very helpful and thorough.

title: Nice experience
body: The services are very good. Yes, it might be a challenge to book an appointment - but the staff is very helpful and willing to offer other option in case you can not be seen face to face.

title: Great service Breast Clinic
body:
I was referred by my GP on a 2 week wait after finding 3 lumps . Had my appointment within the week. All the staff on the unit were absolutely marvellous and I was dealt with in a friendly, professional and caring manner . When you are at your most vulnerable this means so much and I can’t thank them enough for making me feel so at ease.
I was one of the lucky ones today . To have various procedures and receive your results on the same day is incredible. What a wonderful service we have with the NHS . Thank you again to all the dedicated staff and volunteers at Macclesfield Hospital.

title: Great practice
body: Good surgery with friendly staff. Yes can be difficult getting an appointment but that's the same in every surgery nationwide. Recently saw nurse for spirometry and she was extremely patient and so caring and friendly!

title: Excellent practice
body: Everyone is extremely helpful and efficient - reception, pharmacy and doctors are all very focused and committed. The new triage system works excellently and quickly. Nothing but praise for everyone at the practice.

title: First class service
body:
On 18 June we had cause to dial 999 as my elderly mother in law was found unconscious in the shower. Not only was the service speedy and efficient but carried out with the utmost respect for my MIL. The paramedics were absolutely brilliant and she owes her life to them - so saying thank you doesn’t really cover it. 
We (my husband and I ) are so thankful for their speedy assessment of the situation and the swift action they took in an attempt to make my MIL more comfortable. This,  I’m sure played a contributory factor in her recovery. 
Many, many thanks from the friends and family of a 92 year old lady.

title: Good Service As Always
body: I emailed for an appointment for my elderly mother stating her problems. I has a reply and a date for an appointment within a couple of hours. Admin as always we're courteous and helpful.

title: I can only say it was perfect
body: Everything ran so smoothly  . I have been/stayed in this hosp several times over the past years  and its so comforting and everyone is kind. caring   I almost look forward to my visits.. I would not go anywhere else

title: my treatment was on time
body: I was very pleased with the attention given and the manner in which I was treated. I would not hesitate to recommend the practice to my friends.

title: Fantastic Care
body: I recently had a Liver Transplant and would like to thank everyone on the Transplant Team for the care I received during my stay. You are all brilliant !

title: Fantastic Customer Service
body: I have found the customer service provided by  Fittleworth exceptional. The staff really go out of their way to make sure that your order is supplied efficiently and on time and they are truly great at sorting out any problems or issues you have, even when not their fault. Certainly lowers the stress around this sensitive area.

title: Wonderful Staff
body: I received nothing but kindness and care from the staff, which helped me relax and undergo the procedure with less anxiety.

title: Excellent practice
body: GP telephoned me in the timeframe agreed and made several suggestions to help my condition. Was clear and concise and put my mind at rest. Further checkup date arranged at a time that suited me. I have always found GPs, nurses and reception staff at Claremont extremely good, understanding and caring. Thank you all.
